15. Job Enlargement:
Job enlargement means increasing the scope of a job by extending its duties and responsibilities. It motivates employees, enhances productivity, builds capacity, and reduces boredom. Additional salary may sometimes be provided depending on the nature of the task, but it is not compulsory.

16. Behavior Modeling:
NIDA-Pak provides training on behavioral modeling, which focuses on developing employee behavioral and interpersonal skills. This is done by demonstrating management techniques through videos and displays, followed by role-playing exercises in simulated situations.
Recruitment Policy Assessment 7 of 9

Which of the following statements best reflects NIDA-Pakâ€™s approach to Job Enlargement and Behavior Modeling?

answers.option: Job enlargement extends duties to increase motivation and productivity, while behavior modeling develops interpersonal skills through demonstrations and role-playing.
Job enlargement only increases salaries, and behavior modeling focuses solely on technical skills.
Job enlargement reduces workload, and behavior modeling is based on employee self-study.
Both job enlargement and behavior modeling require external trainers only.

content.correct: Correct! Job enlargement increases the scope of duties to boost motivation and productivity, while behavior modeling strengthens interpersonal and behavioral skills through demonstrations and role-play.
content.incorrect: Not quite. The correct answer is that NIDA-Pak uses job enlargement to expand duties and build capacity, and behavior modeling to develop interpersonal skills using demonstrations and simulations.
